_description: A Latin and English rhymed inscription naming the donor of a book — five lines

OxfCCC59.Transcription:
Rex regum riche kirkLux dux princeps ouer al
                    þingffre Cuntis suete þingWalterum protege
                        WaldirkQui me communi librum dedit utilitati
OxfCCC59.Note:
Five lines naming the donor of the MS; MS incorrectly identified by
                    Morris as CCCO 54 instead of 59.
OxfCCC59.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Old English Homilies of the Twelfth Century: From the Unique MS.
                B.14.52 in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge
             Vol. 2. 
             EETS
         o.s. 53 (1873); repr. 1973: 255-9.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             “A Thirteenth-Century Manuscript from Llanthony Priory.” 
             Speculum
         3 (1928): 587-95: 588.
